    • Method Detail

      • AC3Algorithm

        public boolean AC3Algorithm(Sudoku sudoku)
        The arc-consistency algorithm AC-3. After applying AC-3, either every arc is arc-consistent, or some variable has an empty domain, indicating that the CSP cannot be solved.
        Parameters:
        sudoku - csp puzzle
        Returns:
        false if an inconsistency is found and true otherwise

      • revise

        public boolean revise(Sudoku sudoku,
                      Variable X,
                      Variable Y)
        used in AC3 algorithm, revises the domain of a variable relevent to another variable
        Parameters:
        sudoku - - csp puzzle
        X - - a variable
        Y - - another variable
        Returns:
        - true if domain of X is revised, false otherwise

      • initializeArcs

        public void initializeArcs()
        Initialize arcs between all variables. i.e. square (0,0) has 20 arcs as follows: row = {(0,0),(0,1)}, {(0,0),(0,2)} ... {(0,0),(0,8)} col = {(0,0),(1,0)}, {(0,0),(0,2)} ... {(0,0),(8,0)} box = {(0,0),(1,1)}, {(0,0),(1,2)}, {(0,0),(2,1)}, {(0,0),(2,2)}

      • getAvailableArcs

        public java.util.Queue<Arc> getAvailableArcs()
        return a Queue of all initially generated arcs
        Returns:
        queue - all generated arcs

      • printAllArcs

        public void printAllArcs()
        print all generated arcs
